entry.title: [Privacy Sandbox] Add UMA metric for dynamic memory usage of the
entry.content:
attestations map.



base::trace_event::EstimateMemoryUsage is used to estimate the dynamic

memory usage of the attestations map. The map has a type of

base::flat_map
PrivacySandboxAttestationsGatedAPISet>



In which we only need to provide EstimateMemoryUsage for

SchemefulSite and its compositions.



Added EstimateMemoryUsage to

1. net::SchemefulSite

2. url::Origin

3. SchemeHostPort



One alternative considered is to estimate net::SchemefulSite::GetURL()

instead. It returns a GURL, which already offers EstimateMemoryUsage.



From my observation, there will be difference in results. And it

depends on the actual implementation of small string optimization and

the length of the site in map.



On my machine, there are three possible outcomes:

1. E(SchemefulSite) = E(GURL)

2. E(SchemefulSite) + 16 bytes = E(GURL)

3. E(SchemefulSite) + 32 bytes = E(GURL)



*E() stands for estimated memory usage.



Bug: 1464311

Change-Id: I1188d0f52ecddd190fce55f43c95abdf10f5173d

entry.title: Merge adjacent CDATA sections emitted by XML parser
entry.content:
This change makes it so that adjacent CDATA sections (i.e. no other

sibling nodes) in an XML document are merged into a single CDATA node.



https://crrev.com/c/3907930 already made it so that adjacent CDATA

sections that occur on parsing chunk boundaries are merged. This is

because libxml will emit separate CDATA nodes if the chunk boundary

falls within a CDATA section.



However, when a CDATA section doesn't have an ending delimiter in the

current chunk[1], libxml starts chunking the data into 300 character

blocks[2] (XML_PARSER_BIG_BUFFER_SIZE=300).



Note: I'm trying to block parsing of web tests in crbug.com/1416496. Resuming the parser leads to different chunking lengths which shows

up as a failure in

third_party/blink/web_tests/fast/dom/SelectorAPI/resig-SelectorsAPI-test.xhtml

which uses innerHTML and the additional CDATA sections show up,

breaking assumptions the test makes.





[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/libxml/src/parser.c;l=11514;drc=1c03110363c1f60a4c538712f312fa6cd39186c6

[2] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/libxml/src/parser.c;l=11528;drc=1c03110363c1f60a4c538712f312fa6cd39186c6



Bug: 1416496,36431

Change-Id: I88c9b8fc36d8e89ed5404b7a7ea5f40970a11cc9

entry.title: [Android][Autofill] Record user actions for settings navigation
entry.content:
The AutofillAddressesViewed/AutofillCreditCardsViewed user actions

state the chrome://settings/* URLs as a triggers.

In fact, they are also recorded when various surfaces (popup,

fallbacks, snackbars, etc.) trigger the settings.



On Desktop, this is technically true but on Android, the URLs are not

even supported (entering them is an error â€” there is only the

settings page).



Therefore the histogram should also be recorded whenever the

settings page loads the fragment. This benefits a planned

restructuring since we can measure regressions.



The only alternative would be to remove the misleading user action on

Android which is not easier and we would just reintroduce them soon.



Bug: 1472225

Change-Id: I319472e429635d957a2b87d2ecd0206d802af504

entry.title: Reland "cros: Enable kCryptohomeRecovery by default"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit a6c65f327f6729c17326cd469f4f757001987c4f



The revert of the commit we're relanding here was necessary due to the other revert

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4769426.

This other revert had two consequences for recovery:



1. SAML authentication is now managed by ChromeOS again instead of

Gaia. We've since made recovery work also when ChromeOS manages SAML

authentication:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4783270

2. The reauth endpoint is turned off now in all cases except for child

users. After aligning with stakeholders, we're now going to enable

the reauth endpoint just for users with recovery factor:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4782072





Original change's description:

> cros: Enable kCryptohomeRecovery by default

>

> Bug: b:239420609, b:270693613

> Change-Id: Ib47cd574b1576d198a9ffe93847479f37b90ad2f

entry.title: Don't hide the media controls in the CrOS lockscreen if in Incognito
entry.content:
Previously, we hid the media controls from the CrOS lockscreen if the

media was playing in an Incognito or Guest session, as we don't want to

expose the currently playing media metadata if its playing in an

Incognito session. It was also hidden for Guest sessions because we used

the media session's `is_sensitive` field, which is both true for

Incongito and Guest mode sessions.



As we now are replacing the media metadata with placeholder metadata if

in Incognito mode in CrOS, we can now show the media controls in the

CrOS lockscreen, as the original metadata won't be exposed.



Bug: 1447545

entry.title: Make captive portal bypass the MandatoryExtensionsForIncognitoNavigation policy
entry.content:
The MandatoryExtensionsForIncognitoNavigation user policy allows admins

to block Incognito navigation on ChromeOS devices if the user does not

explicitly allow a set of policy configured extensions to run in

Incognito mode.



This policy should only apply to regular OTR profiles.

entry.title: chromebox_for_meetings: Support HMAC device IDs
entry.content:
Sandboxed browser clients cannot access raw device paths, as this

information is obfuscated. Instead, they can use a hashed device ID to

execute XU commands. This CL allows clients to access XU commands

without requiring sensitive device information.

xdg_popup.grab. We currently only use xdg_popup.grab when a CLI flag is

entry.title: [autofill in devtools]: Add formFilled event to the manager observer.
entry.content:
As suggested in crbug.com/4632806, introducing the form filling

notification in this separate CL.



This will be used by protocol/autofill_handler.h

to emit devtools events about filled fields of a form.



1. The FormFieldData and AutofillField are needed to know both

the value and the field server type of a filled field.

2. The profile or credit card are needed so that devtools

will know how to build the address UI.

I will use AutofillAddressUIComponent to do this, there is no privacy

concerns since websites do not have access to devtools.

3. We do not emit this notification for webview because

we cannot have all required params, namely the profile and credit card.



Bug: 1451267

entry.title: Add blocked files error only when kNewFilesPolicyUX is set
entry.content:
If the number of blocked files in the policy error is

larger than 1, a panel item is shown with a review button

that isn't functional if kNewFilesPolicyUX is disabled.

So we only set the number of blocked files, if

kNewFilesPolicyUX is true.



Additionally only add connector blocked files only if

kFileTransferEnterpriseConnectorUI is set. This allows the error

notification to be correct for DLP errors even if connector errors

occurred.

entry.title: graphite: Disallow Graphite without ANGLE Metal
entry.content:
Using Graphite with ANGLE OpenGL has several issues such as having to

use GL_TEXTURE_RECTANGLE_ARB instead of GL_TEXTURE_2D in lots of client

side GL code like WebGL DrawingBuffer. Also, there's no synchronization

guarantees between OpenGL and Metal.



This CL makes GPU process fallback from Graphite to Ganesh/GL if ANGLE

is not using Metal. As a result GpuPreferences.gr_context_type is not

the source of truth regarding whether we're on Ganesh/GL or not so this

CL removes gr_context_type() from SkiaOutputSurfaceDependency and stores

it in the SkiaOutputSurfaceImpl instead on initialization. Similarly

the bottom left origin image flip Y workaround uses the presence of

graphite recorder on SkiaOutputSurfaceImpl to determine if it should be

applied since just checking the feature isn't sufficient to detect GL

fallback case.



This CL also removes IsUsingVulkan() and makes OutputSurface::Type be

either kSkia or kSoftware - Vulkan vs GL vs Dawn shouldn't really be

exposed to the higher levels anyway.



Bug: 1473500

Change-Id: I0ccb0032168e35df561d51450b71a9648f0ac4c8

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4795551

entry.title: [iOS] Fix promo primary button action after screen refresh
entry.content:
In `PromoStyleViewController`, for small screens (iPhone SE for instance), the primary button is used to scroll the screen (showing

"More" text), before the user first scroll the screen to the bottom.

Until then, the original primary action (like sign-in in FRE sign-in

screen) can not be executed and the other action buttons are hidden.

The "already scrolled to end" state is saved in the `didReachBottom`

boolean,



However, the boolean is reset to `NO` in some cases in `viewWillAppear`.

The reset can then happen after a full screen popup is shown then

dismissed. (eg. the add account screen for FRE sign-in), but

`didReachBottom` is never changed to `YES` afterward, preventing the

primary action to be ever triggered when the primary button is tapped.



Since the primary button is not expected to be changed back to a

"read more" button in the controller's lifecycle, and the original

issue resulting in resetting `didReachBottom` to `NO` cannot be

reproduced (crbug.com/1224867), this CL prevents `didReachBottom` from

being reset to `NO` in `viewWillAppear`, to avoid blocking the action

buttons.



This CL also adds an related EGTest, and makes `FakeAuthActivityViewController` to show in full screen mode

on phones to better imitate the real "add account" screen behaviour,

so the added EGTest fails without the fix.



Bug: 1471972

Change-Id: I8f7c3a9b1faf720812f112a641cf364465631e37

entry.title: dlp: Fix pausing of RestoreToDestinationIOTask-s
entry.content:
RestoreToDestinationIOTask constructs an underlying CopyOrMoveIOTask, to

which it offloads the actual moving of the file(s) from Trash to the

selected destination.



Since the destination can be restricted by data protection policies, we

need to show the correct UI to the user when this happens. While we do

check the policies when initiating the move, inside the move task, we

also need to show the proper UI, i.e. support the paused state with

policy params also for restoreToDestination tasks.



Since the underlying move task has the same ID as its restore task, we

can use that to control the restore task from the outside, specifically

to pause/resume/cancel the task if needed because of the policy, even

though we only "see" the move task.



One corner case not yet covered is that the restore task relies on the

progress_callback_ updates from its move task to update its own state.

When the task is resumed, the call is delegated to the move task, which

at some point sets its state to `kInProgress` from `kPaused`, but only

runs the `progress_callback_` with this new progress state AFTER moving

the first of the selected files. If we only have one file, we never

get this update. This is usually not a big issue, since we will switch

to InProgress afterwards, or quickly switch to Completed, but for a

very large first file it could cause some new issues in the UI. This is

tracked in b/295887686.



R=chromeos-dlp@google.com, lucmult@chromium.org



Fixed: b:294537092

Change-Id: I7e8c63418500402ca9b07ea37f3a066a307b6bbf

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4774559

Reviewed-by: Daniel Brinkers

Reviewed-by: Luciano Pacheco

Commit-Queue: Aida Zolic

Reviewed-by: Aya Elsayed

entry.title: Reduce ID3D11VideoProcessor churn in DCLayerTree
entry.content:
Before it stored one VideoProcessor for HDR and one for SDR and recreated

it each time an input or output texture size exceeded current in any dimension.

This could lead to flip-flopping between two states: one with big input texture

and another with big output texture. Each time VideoProcessor would be recreated.



Now it will store one VideoProcessor and recreate it if any of 4 dimensions

(input/output width/height) increases.



To reduce resource usage, a moving window max is used on each of 4 dimensions

separately, so after a prolonged period of using VideoProcessor on smaller textures

a new smaller sizes would be used.



A small utility MovingMax class is also added in this CL.



Bug: 1472975

Change-Id: I16ac9dfa0e3a64f0c10ff895f232a22cb87bb3a1

entry.title: [SHv2] Fix leaked and reused passwords not being detected
entry.content:
This CL fixes an issue where `UpdateInsecureCredentialCountAsync` did

not properly update weak and reused credentials. Those are not stored,

but computed on infrastructure initialization.



Previously, the async update of cached values ended with

`OnSavedPasswordsChanged`, which indicates that the infrastructure is

available, but not that weak and reuse checks have concluded. Now,

`OnInsecureCredentialsChanged` is used for this instead, which notifies

observers after the checks have run.



Bug: 1443466

Change-Id: I46b67e2c545ec94fa14437c43e9f1fdb13886991

entry.title: Include AllocationStackTraceRecorder into Crashpad report - 5/N
entry.content:
With Arm's Memory Tagging Extension enabled, a process shall receive a

SIGSEGV if it encounters a mismatch in memory tags. To help developers

analyse problems like this, we want to include a history of the most

recent allocations and frees in the crashpad report.



This CL introduces the inclusion of the recorder data into the Crashpad

report. For this, the raw data of memory operations is transformed into

a Protocol Buffers message and serialized.



Bug: 1137393

entry.title: iwa: Add task for applying pending updates
entry.content:
This CL adds a new task type to the `IsolatedWebAppUpdateManager` for

applying pending updates that have been discovered previously. Only one

update discovery or apply task can run at a time. Update apply task have

priority over update discovery tasks.

Update apply tasks are started whenever an update apply waiter signals

readiness to apply the update.



The last missing piece is the implementation of a mechanism to:

a) immediately start applying a pending update when the user tries to

open an app with a pending update (or wait for the update to complete

if it is already in progress)

b) prevent users from opening the app while an update is being applied

(we want to ensure that only one version of the app can be running at

the same time)



Bug: 1444407

entry.title: Check UserLevelMemoryPressureSignalGenerator instance when requesting memory pressure signals.
entry.content:
AndroidWebView seems to create renderer processes without invoking

ChromeContentBrowserClient::AppendExtraCommandLineSwitches().

So renderer processes will expect the feature is disabled, but the browser

code directly looks at the feature flag which is enabled-by-default.

This mismatch causes crashes on AndroidWebView.

entry.title: Rename metrics-only APIs related to sync sign-in state.
entry.content:
For the sync deprecation, the Sync team is auditing all calls to their

APIs. This CL simplifies their job by marking metrics-only usages

around the sync sign-in state as such. No behavior changes.

This CL is a fork of crrev.com/c/4750260. See the description of that

CL for additional reasons why this is desirable.



Specifically, this CL does the following:

- Renames the very generic PDM::GetSyncSigninState() to

GetPaymentsSigninStateForMetrics(). It turns out that almost all calls

are for metrics purposes - modulo the exceptions explained below.

This is the majority of this CL's delta.

- Moves AutofillSyncSigninState from sync_utils to

AutofillMetrics::PaymentsSigninState.

- Adds PDM::IsPaymentsWalletSyncTransportEnabled(). Turns out that all

non-metrics uses of PDM::GetSyncSigninState() are checking if

wallet is running in transport mode. There are only three uses of this

function, which the Sync team can audit separately.



Bug: 1462286

Change-Id: I29d7783a265bf6b17929908249268dd48253b5a0

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4783433

entry.title: Expose method to check enterprise policy toggle for CCNS BFCache
entry.content:
An enterprise policy toggle was created in https://crrev.com/c/4568473

to control if BFCaching CCNS page is allowed. In that CL, the toggle was

checked when creating a child process and the command switch was only

added for renderer process. It will break the intended BFCache logic

since the toggle should be checked from the browser process.



This CL adds a method from ContentBrowserClient to tell if BFCache

CCNS page is disabled by the client, and adds some browser tests for

how the toggle will affect the browser logic.

entry.title: [keepalive-migration] Fix flaky behavior caused by race between redirect
entry.content:
handling and renderer disconnection[1]



This CL refactors the redirect handling according to the comment[2]: if a URL leads >= 1 redirects, all redirects will be verified in-browser first and gets stored, until any of (1) `OnReceiveResponse()` (2) `OnComplete()` (3) `OnNetworkConnectionError()` (4) `OnRendererDisconnectionError()` is triggered, the stored data will then be forwarded to renderer if it is still alive.



See `KeepAliveURLLoader::ForwardURLLoad()` for more details.

The sequence diagram can be found at [3].



Also add browser tests to cover `navigator.sendBeacon()`'s multiple

redirects behaviors & CORS behaviors.



[1]: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4297494/6..19/content/browser/loader/keep_alive_url_loader.cc#b86

[2]: https://crrev.com/c/4717687/10..12/content/browser/loader/keep_alive_url_loader.cc#b665

[3]: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ZzxMMBvpqn8VZBZKnb7Go8TWjnrGcXuLS_USwVVRUvY/edit?pli=1#heading=h.d006i46pmq9

entry.title: LoAF: Make sure callbacks don't cancel promise resolver attribution
entry.content:
Some callbacks (e.g. URLSearchParams.forEach) can be invoked

synchronously. If there is a pending promise resolver, those callbacks

should not cancel it as pending.



Fixed by using the existing user_callback_counter to also account

for promise resolvers.



The callback in the bug is TrustedTypePolicy.CreateHTML, but using

URLSearchParams.forEach in the test as it's more widely supported.

entry.title: Lacros Test: Add support to verify/close web based UIs in ash.
entry.content:
One of the annoying issues with lacros browser tests running

with shared ash is that some tests may open a UI in Ash (some

times by accident) and it will fail the tests running after

it, which makes the tests flaky and is hard to catch the culprit.



This cl adds the following support in InProcessBrowserTest for

lacros browser tests running with ash to prevent such issues:



1. Verify that there is no ash browser based UI such as SWA,

web UI. etc open before the test starts and after the test finishes.



2. Provide API to close all ash browser windows from lacros

browser tests.



The test should be responsible for managing the

browser windows it opens in ash, and making sure they are cleaned

up before the test tears down. Otherwise, InProcessBrowserTest will

catch the problem and fail the test.



Note this cl only fixes the issue with the web based UI. Some UI generated in ash are not web based, for example, a dialog derived

from DialogDelegateView. We will fix these UI later.



Bug: 1473375,1446083,1473402

Change-Id: If2d8dd6496ae47f61a21174328953d30b9a69fd8

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4757644

entry.title: Reland "Add metrics that counts up speculation rules prerenders per page"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit a562791e2ddfea758dd6faec8ad9ee9d8c73123e



The reason of the revert was the failure of the introduced browsertest

on Fuchsia and iOS, which is because pointer simulation on both

platforms does not work properly in regards to that test.

This reland inactivates that browsertests on fuchsia and iOS tentatively.



Original change's description:

> Add metrics that counts up speculation rules prerenders per page

>

> This CL introduces the metric that records the number of eventually received speculation rules prerender triggers per primary page changed,

> classified with their eagerness.

>

> This aims to investigate the overall latest usage amount of speculation

> rules prerenders that developers actually try to use in one page, as

> well as their difference on each eagerness. This is expected to be an

> insight to improve prerender limits and schedulers.

>

> Bug: 1464021

> Change-Id: I88aaa17dab5e1d0dbec79a24338c3c3ef0680416

entry.title: [FilesBulkPinning] Show progress information when calculating storage
entry.content:
Currently when the user enters the "Calculating storage space" stage and

they have a sizeable corpus, it can appear as if nothing is happening.

To avoid this happening (e.g. for a large corpus this could be

O(minutes)), let's periodically show how many files were listed. This

rate limits the UI updates to every 5s.



Bug: b/296113391

Test: browser_tests --gtest_filter=*XfBulkPinningDialog*

entry.title: Skip Intel AV1 hybrid encoder when enumerating hardware encoders.
entry.content:
Intel AV1 hybrid encoder was blocked during activating by [1], but it's

still available during enumerating. Hence, WebCodecs

VideoEncoder.configure() may fail even the configuration is checked by

VideoEncoder.isConfigSupported().



[1] https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/2eaff22fdb35296e6d7a70cfd8398a1f75e5c51f



Bug: None

entry.title: Revert "AbortSignal: Deflake memory tests"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 22d5e228c6c4deed553010e195583fe23971c172.



Reason for revert: This CL seems to cause continuous WPT failures.

https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1474279



Original change's description:

> AbortSignal: Deflake memory tests

>

> The abort signal memory tests rely on a single synchronous gc() to

> collect signals and trigger finalization registry callbacks, which has

> become flaky on Mac (worker tests only). The implementation was changed

> recently, but the tests were reliably passing from 8/10 -- 8/16. The

> change to use a per-Worker microtask queue in crrev.com/c/4781406 may

> have caused the tests to start flaking (timing lines up, reverting it

> locally fixes things), but it's not clear how that's affecting GC.

>

> Testing on a Mac locally I found the third test fails fairly reliably, but attempts to debug it (heap snapshots w/ GC removed, console logs, tracing, etc.) removed the flakiness. Adding a second gc() reliably

> fixes the third test, but other tests still fail (less often).

>

> This CL refactors the tests to speculatively fix the flakes:

> 1. Run GC asynchronously. It's possible something on the stack is

> holding onto the signal. This probably needs to be done anyways for

> conservative stack scanning (other tests have been similarly

> refactored to use.

> 2. Because of (1), change tests to use WeakRef instead of finalization

> registry. This is cleaner and will fail before the timeout, giving

> more insight into failures.

> 3. Do multiple rounds of gc. I found doing gc() multiple times fixed

> test 3, but that could have also just changed timing. But blink

> unit tests run GC in a loop, so it seems reasonable to do this to

> ensure collection occurs in case multiple cycles are needed.

>

> Locally on mac, the memory tests pass with these changes with

> --repeat-each=1000, and I didn't find any flakes on the Mac bots.

>

> Bug: 1473373

> Change-Id: Ib6a65ce52372c5220126b490aee79e8f4b33e183

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4787951

> Commit-Queue: Scott Haseley

> Reviewed-by: Mason Freed

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1185373}



Bug: 1473373

Change-Id: Ic395066fb034d7dbfcca77a4b62752a1ffe5c4dc

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4796929
